comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content:
Dear SunflowerLiger and viewers,
The Peppermint Lounge is not listed in the 1962 or 1963 Sydney Telephone Directories. If any viewer knows, we would be grateful for the information.

comment.author: 69458275@N05
comment._content: Hum, is it just me, or is Peppermint Lounge in NY and not in Australia? Because there is a hugely famous Peppermint Lounge in NY and apparently no one can find it in Sidney... en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peppermint_Lounge

comment.author: 52793272@N03
comment._content: I remember Sabrina. She used to be in Arthur Askey's TV shows in the 1950s.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Per this 'Hall of Fame' item on Lee Gordon, the Peppermint Lounge was in Goulburn Street (mentioned in first paragraph on page 4) www.liveperformance.com.au/halloffame/leegordon4.html news.google.com/newspapers?id=24NWAAAAIBAJ&sjid=9OUDA... ...Mr Laws might be worth quizzing re the exact location...he might even know the names of the chaps playing the instruments. As JL's article indicates, the New York Peppermint Lounge was the inspiration. There should still be quite a few people around who can tell us more about the 1960s Sydney Peppermint Lounge...my guess is it attracted a seriously cool clientele.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: PS. If the Peppermint Lounge crowd were cool, this other lot were even cooler (!) [http://www.flickr.com/photos/29454428@N08/5949033597/in/photolist-a4GmqM]

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: For years there was a downstairs bar/lounge one to the west of Pitt Street, on the southwest corner of Pitt and Goulburn Streets. It changed names several times but in one incarnation was Chequers?? RW
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection
